title: 105_hr4017
content: The Act may be cited as the "Energy Conservation Reauthorization Act of 1998". Amendments are made to the Energy Policy and Conservation Act. Amendments to the Energy Policy and Conservation Act include authorizing appropriations for interagency working groups, state energy conservation programs, and schools and hospitals for fiscal years 1999 through 2003. "Authorization of appropriations for energy conservation programs from 1999 to 2003 under the Energy Conservation and Production Act, including weatherization programs and energy savings performance contracts." SEC. 4 amends the National Energy Conservation Policy Act regarding the sunset provision and the definition of "Federal agency." SEC. 5 makes technical amendments. SEC. 5 makes technical amendments to the Energy Policy and Conservation Act, including changes to the table of contents such as replacing "efficiency" with "conservation" and adding a section on encouraging the use of alternative fuels. The text chunk discusses technical amendments to the Energy Policy and Conservation Act, including changes to the table of contents to encourage the use of alternative fuels for Federal vehicles, trucks, buses, and motor fuels. The text chunk contains technical amendments to the Energy Policy and Conservation Act, including changes to various sections such as 322, 324, 325, 336, 345, and 362. The text chunk includes technical amendments to various sections of the Energy Policy and Conservation Act, such as 391, 394, 400, and 400D. The Energy Policy and Conservation Act is amended by making technical changes to sections 400D(a), 400I(b), 400AA, 503, and 552(d)(5)(A). The Energy Policy and Conservation Act is amended to make technical changes to various sections, including regulations and rulings in section 106 and the insertion of a new item relating to section 207. The National Energy Conservation Policy Act is amended to make changes to the table of contents, including revisions to section 216 and part 6 of title II. The National Energy Conservation Policy Act is amended to make changes to various sections, including correcting typographical errors in section 216, 251, 266, and 551. SEC. 6. MATERIALS ALLOCATION AUTHORITY EXTENSION. Amends Section 104(b) of the Energy Policy and Conservation Act. SEC. 7. BIODIESEL FUEL USE CREDITS. Adds a new section titled "BIODIESEL FUEL USE CREDITS" to Title III of the Energy Policy Act of 1992. The Secretary will allocate credits for biodiesel fuel purchases containing at least 20 percent biodiesel by volume for vehicles over 8,500 pounds, with exceptions for alternative fueled vehicles or purchases required by law. The Secretary has the authority to modify the 20 percent biodiesel volume requirement. The Secretary may lower the 20 percent biodiesel volume requirement for cold start, safety, or vehicle function reasons. Fleet or covered persons must provide documentation to support credit allocation. Credits can be used to treat biodiesel purchases as acquisitions of alternative fueled vehicles required by law. The Secretary may issue a rule before January 1, 1999, to establish procedures for implementing credits for alternative fueled vehicles. Data collection is required for making determinations, and biodiesel is defined as a diesel fuel substitute. The term 'biodiesel' is defined as a diesel fuel substitute produced from nonpetroleum renewable resources that meets EPA registration requirements. The term 'qualifying volume' is set at 450 gallons, or higher if the Secretary determines average annual alternative fuel use exceeds this amount. The Energy Policy Act of 1992 may be amended to include these definitions. "Sec. 312. Biodiesel fuel use credits."
